parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From kata and klino; to recline down, i.e. to take a place at table.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed. From a compound of eu and logos; to speak well of, i.e. to bless.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To break (in pieces), break bread. A primary verb; to break.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) trans: I hand in, give up, (b) intrans: I give way (to the wind). From epi and didomi; to give over.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
